forecast.name: Today
forecast.detailedForecast: Snow after 10am. Cloudy. High near 30, with temperatures falling to around 24 in the afternoon. North wind 3 to 7 mph. Chance of precipitation is 100%. New snow accumulation of 7 to 11 inches possible.

forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.detailedForecast: Snow. Cloudy. Low around 20, with temperatures rising to around 28 overnight. Northeast wind 8 to 14 mph, with gusts as high as 26 mph. Chance of precipitation is 100%. New snow accumulation of 10 to 16 inches possible.

weather_report:
In Boston today, the landscape is draped in a heavy blanket of clouds, foreboding yet artfully creating an atmosphere of calm as the city prepares for the arrival of winter’s grace. Snow begins its descent shortly after the morning’s hush, promising to envelop the world outside in soft silence. The air, crisp and biting, will dip to a high of 30 degrees before retreating into the realm of the mid-20s by afternoon. Enthralled in this snowfall, residents can expect an impressive accumulation, transforming the city into a chic winter wonderland.

As night falls, the precipitation will intensify, with steady snow continuing and temperatures crawling back up, hinting at an uncharacteristically warm evening for January. Winds from the northeast may stir the snowflakes into a playful dance, inviting thoughts of cozy evenings by the fire. It would be wise to dress in layers; warm coats paired with insulated gloves and sturdy boots will ensure comfort against the chill and the accumulating snow. For those brave enough to venture out, a quiet stroll through snow-laden parks or a visit to your favorite coffee shop will provide a pleasing contrast to the snowy backdrop. The beauty of winter is not to be rushed; embrace it for all its quietude and snowy charm.
